content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-050-03-B |Item_parent=Genito-scrotal pathology in boys and men |Item_parent_short=Genito-scrotal pathology in boys and men |Rank=B |Title=Photographs: transilluminated bursa, non-transilluminated bursa |Description=None |Rubric=Multimedia content |Contributors=Cédric Lebâcle, Alice Faure |Order=3}} '''Transilluminable stock exchange:''' [[File:Bouse transilluminable1.png|vignette|Bourse transilluminable |alt=|néant]]

properties.question: In genito-scrotal ultrasound, a transilluminated bursa is indicative of which condition?
properties.option_a: A non-transilluminated bursa associated with hydrocele.
properties.option_b: A transilluminated bursa indicating the presence of a scrotal hernia.
properties.option_c: A transilluminated bursa, which is a normal finding and suggests a hydrocele.
properties.option_d: A non-transilluminated bursa suggesting the presence of a varicocele.
